reviews.title: Leaves ring on wood surfaces.
reviews.review_text: These left rings inside my dinnerware drawer, pantry, and even on the butcherblock countertop. Dishes are dry before they are put away. It looks like a mold ring anywhere they were placed for an extended time. They were removed from a drawer and placed in the pantry and still a ring. They sat dry out of the box on my countertop and left rings. Lucky they didnt sit there for very long. I have large rings from the plates, medium from the saucer and the bowls leave rings as well. Photos attached, before and after I wiped them with bleach. On the other hand, I love the colors, I was looking for nontoxic dinnerware.

reviews.title: Practical %26 colorful.
reviews.review_text: Not really what I would consider stoneware except for design, they are practical. Bowls are deep for my liking so don't plan on using. Otherwise, colorful design %26 practical dinnerware.

reviews.title: broken plate
reviews.review_text: I have had these in original package, waiting to close on our new home. We moved today and the packaging was secure, but one red dinner plate was chipped. It appears to have been that way before packing.

reviews.title: Hot Plates
reviews.review_text: I bought two sets and have had them 2 weeks. Most of the plates have deep chips in them from normal use. I want buyers to know these plates get HOT when microwaved. Not normal hot, I would have to use a pot holder to get it from the microwave after 2-3 minutes. I couldn't let my young kids microwave anything on them because I was afraid they'd get burned. I'm returning these this week.

reviews.title: Pretty but not durable
reviews.review_text: It's been about 6 months and the plates are already chipping from being washed in the dishwasher. The dishes are pretty, although a bit browner than in the photos due to the brown colored lines. The dishes are relatively inexpensive so I'd probably order them again in the future.
They are nice dishes but chip easily. Also some plates are deeper than others so they are not all made the same way.
Would prefer the small plate be a little bigger, more like a dessert or salad plate, since there are no coffee cups.

reviews.title: Pretty & functional
reviews.review_text: ....but the colored edges mean you have to be careful about chipping off the edges & ruining the pretty finish.

reviews.title: For the price probably OK deal.
reviews.review_text: One of the two sets came with 2 yellow bowls and no blue bowl. The edge of one of the dinner plates is not smooth.

reviews.title: Inconsistent pattern
reviews.review_text: There were some areas without circle pattern, so pattern was inconsistent.

reviews.title: don't bother
reviews.review_text: Save your money. We liked the design and colors so we bought 2 sets. They say microwave safe. Your food isn't heated, but the plate certainly is. As for the durability, we aren't hard on them, but you don't need to be. They chip and crack worse than any dishes we've ever owned. We had 8 bowls to start and less than a year later, we have 2 left. The saucers and plates aren't much better.

I read some of the reviews about dishes getting really hot and was concerned about it because the last dishes I bought exploded in the microwave. They were even microwave safe and expensive. I have not had any problems with that. It is a great deal for the price.

reviews.title: Sturdy plates,,,
reviews.review_text: I have only the plates BUT would like info as to where to purchase the bowls n salad plates seperately???HELP!!!

reviews.title: Pretty but light weight
reviews.review_text: Pretty colors but very light weight. I planned for daily use but I'm concerned they will chip so I've put them away for guest dinners.
